Authors: Utama D.N., Ariyadi R., Hadi I., Seputra M.R., Setiawan Y.
Title: Fuzzy-DSM for Evaluating Waste's Hazardousness
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference on ICT for Smart Society: Innovation and Transformation Toward Smart Region, ICISS 2019
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Information System Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Utama, D.N., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ariyadi, R., UIN Syarif Hidayatullah, Information System Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hadi, I., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Seputra, M.R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Setiawan, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Waste, without good management for treating, is able to influence environment and human health negatively. This condition needs extraordinary effort to handle. The study was performed to construct a decision support model (DSM) for evaluating waste's hazardous level. Via combined methods fuzzy-logic and analytic hierarchical process (AHP), a DSM finally was able to be developed. Two main criteria and six sub-criteria are considered to become fundamental part of the model. The model was experimented thru four types of waste; and conclusively, industrial waste water has been the most unsafe waste for both health and environment. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: analytic hierarchical process; decision support system; environment; fuzzy logic; hazardousness; health; Waste
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Computer circuits; Decision support systems; Fuzzy logic; Hazards; Health; Wastes; Analytic hierarchical process; Combined method; Decision support models; environment; Hazardousness; Health and environment; Human health; Waste management
